comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content:
It seems a little unfair to describe this as a toy.  Bain doesn't seem able to make up his mind between toy and model in this set of photos, but given it seems to be a recognisable class of boat model seems the better description.

I wonder why some are called one and some the other.

Is it a cutter?

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Yes.  It's a gaff cutter, or more fully, a gaff-rigged cutter.  A cutter has one mast and at least two foresails (jibs).  The gaff is the spar pointing up at an angle to the mast.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
31580040@N04
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/23103743@N05] 

Thanks, I tried looking it up but wasn't sure if I found the right name.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Date on the negative is 6/3/21. Likely taken at Conservatory Water (known in the 20's as Conservatory Lake, near 5th avenue and 73rd street.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks so much swanq for naming the type of model yacht we are looking at in the race.  And thanks to both of you for identifying the lake in Central Park. We'll add some of this information to the records for these images the next time we update.
